conclusion: Understand the system with four blocks, B and C connected by a spring, and force F applied to block B.
All blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration, consider the system as a rigid body.
Apply Newton's Second Law to the system: total force is F, total mass is 4m.
Block D is part of the system and accelerates with acceleration a.
The force causing block D to accelerate is the static friction force f.
Relate the force to the acceleration for block D: f = ma.
Substitute the acceleration into the force equation: f = F / 4.
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D is F/4.
